gurmukhi: ਕਰੁਨਾਨਿਧ ਦੇਖ ਦਸ਼ਾ ਤਿਹ ਕੀ ਕਰੁਨਾਰਸ ਕੳੁ ਚਿਤ ਬੀਚ ਬਢਾਯੋ || ਕੋਪਹਿ ਛਾਡਿ ਦਯੋ ਹਰਿ ਜੂ ਦੁਹੂੰ ਨੈਨਨਿ ਭੀਤਰ ਨੀਰ ਬਹਾਯੋ ||
transliteration: Karounaa-nidh Dekh Dashaatih Kikarounaa-ras Kau Chit Beech Badhaayo|| Kopah(i) Chhaad(i) Dayo Har(i) Joo Duhoon Nainan(i) Bheetar Neer Bahaayo||
translation: Krishna, the treasure of compassion, seeing him in such a plight, was wonder-struck and forsaking his anger, caused to flow tears from both his eyes;

gurmukhi: ਬੀਰ ਹਲਾਯੁਧ ਠਾਢੋ ਹੁਤੋ ਤਿਹ ਕੋ ਕਰ ਕੈ ੲਿਹ ਬੈਨ ਸੁਨਾਯੋ || ਛਾਡਿ ਦੈ ਜੋ ਹਮ ਜੀਤਨ ਅਾਯੋ ਹੋ ਸੋ ਹਮ ਜੀਤ ਲਯੋ ਬਿਲਖਾਯੋ ||੧੮੮੧||
transliteration: Beer Halaayudh Thaadho Houto Tih Ko Kar Kai Eh Bain Sounaayo|| Chhaad(i) Dai Jo Ham Jeetan Aayo Ho So Ham Jeet Layo Bikhaayo||1881||
translation: Seeing his brother (a hero) standing there, he said this, “Leave him, to whom we had come to conquer, we have conquered him.”1881.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਛੋਡ ਹਲੀ ਨਹੀ ਛੋਡਤ ਹੋ ਕਿਹ ਕਾਜ ਕਹਿਓ ਤੁਹਿ ਬਾਨਨਿ ਮਾਰਯੋ || ਜੀਤ ਲਯੋ ਤੋ ਕਹਾ ਭਯੋ ਸਯਾਮ ਬਡੋ ਅਰਿ ਹੈ ੲਿਹ ਪੳੁਰਖ ਹਾਰਯੋ ||
transliteration: Eh Chhodh Halinahichhodhat Ho Kih Kaaj Kahio Tuhe Baanan(i) Mdaryo|| Jeet Layo To Kahaa Bhayo Syaam Bado Ar(i) Hai Eh Paurakh Hdaryo||
translation: Balram said, “I have not conquered him by discharging arrows at him and then leave him; what, if I have conquered him; he is a very great and powerful enemy,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਛੋ ਰਥੀ ਹੈ ਭਯੋ ਬਿਰਥੀ ਅਰੁ ਪਾੲਿ ਗਹੈ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਤੇਰੇ ੳੁਚਾਰਯੋ || ਤੇੲੀਸ ਛੋਹਨੀ ਕੋ ਪਤਿ ਹੈ ਤੋ ਕਹਾ ੲਿਹ ਕੋ ਸਭ ਸੈਨ ਸੰਘਾਰਯੋ ||੧੮੮੨||
transliteration: Oochhodhrathihai Bhayo Birthiar(u) Paae Gadai Prabh Dere Ouchdaryo|| Teees Chhodhniko Pat(i) Hai To Kahaa Eh Ko Sabh Sain Sanhdaryo||1882||
translation: “Who is also a great charioteer and at this time, having been deprived of his chariot, O Lord ! he has fallen at your feet and saying these things; he is the master of twenty-three extremely large military units and if he had to leave him, then why we hav

gurmukhi: ਸੈਨ ਬਡੋ ਸੰਗਿ ਸ਼ੱਤ੍ਰ ਕੇ ਜੀਤ ਤਾਹਿ ਤੇ ਜੀਤ || ਛਾਡਤ ਹੈ ਨਹਿ ਬਧਤ ਤਿਹ ੲਿਹੈ ਬਡਨ ਕੀ ਰੀਤ ||੧੮੮੩||
transliteration: Sain Bado San(i) Shattra Ke Jeet Taah(i) Te Jeet|| Chhaadat Hai Nah(i) Badhat Tih Ihai Badan Kireet||1883||
translation: To conquer a very big army alongwith the enemy is considered a victory and this has been the practice of greatness that instead of killing the enemy, he is set free.1883.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਗ ਦੲੀ ਅਰੁ ਬਾਗੋ ਦਯੋ ੲਿਕ ਸਯੰਦਨ ਦੈ ਤਿਹ ਛਾਡਿ ਦਯੋ ਹੈ || ਭੂਪ ਚਿਤੈ ਹਰਿ ਕੋ ਚਿਤ ਮੈ ਅਤਿ ਹੀ ਕਰ ਲੱਜਤਵਾਨ ਭਯੋ ਹੈ ||
transliteration: Paag Daiar(u) Baago Dayo Ik Syandan Dai Tih Chhaad(i) Dayo Hai|| Bhoop Chitai Har(i) Ko Chit Mai At(i) Hikar Lajjat-vaan Bhayo Hai||
translation: Jarasandh was set free by giving him one turban, clothes and a chariot; considering the greatness of Krishna, the king was extremely ashamed;

gurmukhi: ਗ੍ਰੀਵ ਨਿਵਾੲਿ ਮਹਾ ਦੁਖੁ ਪਾੲਿ ਘਨੋ ਪਛੁਤਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਧਾਮ ਗਯੋ ਹੈ || ਸ੍ਰੀ ਜਦੁਬੀਰ ਕੳੁ ਚੳੁਦਹ ਲੋਕਨ ਸਯਾਮ ਭਨੈ ਜਸੁ ਪੂਰ ਰਹਯੋ ਹੈ ||੧੮੮੪||
transliteration: Greev Nivaae Mahaa Doukh(u) Paae Ghano Pachhudaae Kai Dhaam Gado Hai|| Drijadoubeer Kau Chaudah Lokan Syaam Bhanai Jas(u) Poor Rahyo Hai||1884||
translation: He went back to his home, repenting in affliction; in this way, the praise of Krishna spread in all the fourteen world.1884.

gurmukhi: ਤੇੲੀਸ ਛੋਹਨ ਤੇੲੀਸ ਬਾਰ ਅਯੋਧਨ ਤੇ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਅੈਸੇ ਹੀ ਮਾਰੇ || ਬਾਜ ਘਨੇ ਗਜਪਤਿ ਹਨੇ ਕਬਿ ਸਯਾਮ ਭਨੇ ਬਿਪਤੇ ਕਰ ਡਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Teees Chhodhan Teis Baar Ayodhan Te Prabh Aise Himdare|| Baaj Ghane Gadpat(i) Hane Kabi Syaam Bhane Bipte Kar Ddare||
translation: Krishna destroyed the twenty-three extremely large military units in this way for twenty-three times; he killed many horses and elephants,

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕ ਹੀ ਬਾਨ ਲਗੇ ਹਰਿ ਕੋ ਜਮਧਾਮ ਸੋੳੂ ਤਜਿ ਦੇਹ ਪਧਾਰੇ || ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬ੍ਰਿਜਰਾਜ ਕੀ ਜੀਤ ਭੲੀ ਅਰ ਤੇੲੀਸ ਬਾਰਨ ਅੈਸੇ ੲੀ ਹਾਰੇ ||੧੮੮੫||
transliteration: Ek Hibaan Lage Har(i) Ko Jamdhaam Sooo Tajj(i) Deh Padhdare|| Sribrijraaj Kijeet Bhaiar Teees Baaran Aise Ihdare||1885||
translation: And even with a single arrow, they abandoned there bodies and went to the abode of Yama; Krishna was victorious and in this way Jarasandh was defeated for twenty-three times.1885.
